intro: Appendicula dalatensis, commonly known as the Dalat appendicula, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
